x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Refugees and asylum seekers face overwhelming barriers accessing essential services due to fragmented systems, language barriers, complex documentation requirements, and lack of coordination between government agencies, NGOs, and service providers. They often navigate 10+ different organizations for basic needs (housing, healthcare, legal aid, employment, education), each with different application processes, eligibility criteria, and documentation requirements. This results in delayed access to critical services, duplicate efforts, lost documentation, and poor outcomes during the critical resettlement period.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A comprehensive ServiceNow-based platform serving as a "single front door" for refugee services. Refugees create one secure profile with document vault, language preferences, and needs assessment. The system intelligently routes them to appropriate services, tracks application progress across all agencies, automates eligibility checking, schedules appointments, provides multilingual chatbot support, and connects them with cultural orientation resources. Case managers from multiple organizations collaborate in real-time on shared cases while maintaining proper data privacy. The platform includes mobile app for on-the-go access, SMS notifications for appointment reminders, integration with government databases for verification, and analytics dashboard for funders and policymakers.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Government identity verification systems (USCIS, local DMV, Social Security)
  • Translation APIs (Google Translate, DeepL)
  • SMS gateway (Twilio)
  • Document verification services
  • Housing databases and job boards APIs
  • Healthcare provider directories
  • Legal aid management systems
  • Educational institution databases
  • Payment processing for fee assistance
  • Biometric authentication (optional)

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Data Privacy: Handling sensitive refugee information with security clearances, varying by country of origin

Multi-Agency Coordination: Aligning different organizations with competing priorities and systems

Digital Literacy: Many refugees have limited tech experience or access

Trust Building: Refugees may be wary of government systems due to past trauma

Language Complexity: Supporting 50+ languages with cultural nuances

Funding: Sustained funding across multiple agencies with different fiscal years

Legacy Systems: Integrating with outdated government databases

Connectivity: Refugees may lack smartphones or reliable internet access

Cultural Sensitivity: Ensuring platform respects diverse cultural norms and practices
